input: Design the currency system for Infinite Voyage. We need a primary currency for everyday transactions, a premium currency for cosmetics, and a faction-specific currency for reputation rewards.
expected_behavior: Produces currency definitions with sources (faucets), sinks, exchange rules, and earning rates. Includes a sink-faucet flow diagram. Flags any pay-to-win concerns with the premium currency.
rubric: Each currency has defined faucets and sinks
No currency conversion creates arbitrage loops
Premium currency is cosmetic-only
Earning rates target reasonable play sessions
Includes flow diagram

description: Create a loot table with probability verification
input: Create a loot table for the Nebula Drake boss. It should drop crafting materials (common), equipment (uncommon/rare), and a legendary mount (very rare with pity system).
expected_behavior: Produces a complete loot table with item names, rarity tiers, drop rates, and a pity system for the legendary drop. Verifies probabilities sum correctly. Calculates expected runs for each rarity tier.
rubric: Drop rates sum to valid probability
Rarity tiers follow standard distribution
Pity system prevents extreme bad luck
Expected runs calculated for each tier
Items tie to crafting and economy systems

description: Analyze economy health and detect inflation
input: After adding a new quest zone, players are earning 40% more gold per hour but spending hasn't changed. What should we do?
expected_behavior: Identifies the inflation risk, calculates projected impact, and recommends specific interventions: reducing faucet rates, adding new sinks, or both. Provides a priority-ordered fix list.
rubric: Correctly identifies inflation risk
Quantifies the projected impact
Recommends specific parameter changes
Suggests both immediate and long-term fixes
References economy-anti-patterns.md principles

description: Audit vendor shop pricing for internal consistency
input: Review the attached Starport Bazaar price list (see evals/files/item-price-list-draft.md). Validate sell-to-buy ratios, cross-tier pricing curves, rarity multiplier consistency, and flag any arbitrage opportunities or outlier prices.
expected_behavior: Produces a structured audit identifying every inconsistency: outlier sell:buy ratios (Photon Annihilator at 13%, Nebula Weave Mantle at 14%, Dark Matter Residue at 70%), the underpriced Graviton Hammer relative to Tier 2 peers, the Warp Fuel Cell's abnormally high 45% sell-back rate, and any crafting-material arbitrage paths. Recommends corrected prices with reasoning. Verifies that damage-per-GC and armor-per-GC curves are monotonically reasonable across tiers.
rubric: Identifies all outlier sell:buy ratios and proposes a target band (e.g. 25-35%)
Detects the Graviton Hammer underpricing relative to Tier 2 damage/cost curve
Flags crafting material sell prices that could enable buy-sell arbitrage loops
Validates that price-per-stat-point scales consistently within and across tiers
Provides corrected price table with explicit reasoning for each adjustment

description: Analyze time-to-afford pacing at milestone levels
input: Using the gear cost ladder (see evals/files/gear-cost-ladder.md), evaluate whether progression pacing is healthy at each milestone. Check if time-to-afford scales smoothly, identify any walls or trivial gaps, and recommend adjustments for milestones that feel too grindy or too easy.
expected_behavior: Produces a milestone-by-milestone analysis showing time-to-afford in both hours and real-world play sessions (assuming 2h/day). Identifies Milestone 2 as a potential early-game churn risk (11 hours before player investment), flags the Milestone 5-to-6 jump as a harsh doubling, evaluates the endgame daily cap's 9-day gate, and recommends alternative progression paths (crafting shortcuts, faction rewards, trading) to smooth the curve. Includes a pacing chart or table showing ideal vs. current time-to-afford.
rubric: Converts raw hours into real-world play sessions and calendar days
Identifies Milestone 2 as an early-game retention risk with specific fix proposals
Flags the Milestone 5-to-6 doubling and recommends smoothing the curve
Evaluates the endgame daily cap as a time-gate and assesses player impact
Suggests at least two alternate progression paths to supplement pure GC grinding

description: Evaluate premium currency store against pay-to-win thresholds
input: Audit the proposed Stardust premium store (see evals/files/premium-currency-features.md). Classify each item category (A through D) on a pay-to-win severity scale. Evaluate the F2P earning rate fairness. Flag any items that cross the pay-to-win line and recommend alternatives.
expected_behavior: Produces a severity-rated audit of all four item categories. Category A (cosmetics) passes cleanly. Category B (convenience) is evaluated item-by-item, with Credit Booster flagged as borderline P2W since GC buys power. Category C (progression acceleration) is flagged as soft P2W with specific reasoning per item. Category D is rejected entirely with replacement suggestions (cosmetic-only alternatives). The F2P earning rate is analyzed showing 5 weeks for the cheapest cosmetic is punishing, with recommendations to increase free SD earning by 2-3x. Season Pass Premium Track+ level skip is evaluated for competitive impact.
rubric: Classifies each store category on a clear P2W severity scale with per-item ratings
Identifies Credit Booster as borderline P2W due to GC-to-gear conversion path
Rejects all Category D items and proposes cosmetic-only replacements
Quantifies the F2P earning gap and recommends a specific improved earning rate
Evaluates Season Pass level skip for competitive fairness implications

description: Validate crafting recipe costs against material farming and vendor buy prices
input: Using material drop sources and crafting recipes (see evals/files/material-drop-sources.md), analyze whether crafting costs are balanced. For each recipe, calculate the total cost via farming vs. vendor purchase, compare the crafted item value to its vendor buy price, and verify that crafting is a meaningful currency sink rather than a shortcut or a trap.
expected_behavior: Produces a cost breakdown per recipe showing: total material cost (farming time converted to GC-equivalent), total material cost (vendor purchase), crafting fee, and final crafted item value vs. vendor buy price. Identifies whether each recipe is a net GC sink (intended) or accidentally profitable. Flags if any recipe's farming path is dramatically cheaper or more expensive than vendor-buying materials. Validates that higher-tier recipes require proportionally more effort. Checks that the Transcendent Blade's legendary material bottleneck (Dark Matter Residue at 0.2/hr drop) creates appropriate endgame time-gating without being punishing.
rubric: Calculates both farming-path and vendor-path costs for each recipe with GC totals
Verifies each recipe acts as a net currency sink (crafted value < total input cost)
Flags any recipe where vendor-buy vs farm-time costs diverge by more than 50%
Validates that recipe difficulty scales proportionally with output rarity tier
Assesses the legendary material time-gate and whether drop rates need adjustment

description: Structured audit of live economy faucets, sinks, and health indicators
input: Perform a full economy health audit using the attached snapshot data (see evals/files/economy-snapshot.json). Evaluate faucet/sink balance, inflation trajectory, wealth distribution, and the impact of recent changes. Produce a priority-ordered action plan.
expected_behavior: Produces a structured audit report covering: (1) Faucet/sink imbalance — the 22.6% daily surplus is in the warning zone per health indicator thresholds, driven by the new daily login bonus (7M GC/day) and Void Rift quest faucet increase. (2) Inflation — 8.8% monthly is above the 5% healthy threshold. (3) Wealth inequality — Gini of 0.72 and top 1% holding 38.5% signals whale concentration. (4) Recent changes analysis — identifies the login bonus and repair cost reduction as compounding the surplus. Recommends specific interventions: reduce login bonus or add new sinks, introduce GC costs for new Void Rift content, add prestige/cosmetic sinks for high-balance players. Provides a 30/60/90-day action timeline.
rubric: Correctly identifies the 22.6% surplus as warning-level and traces it to specific faucets
Flags monthly inflation at 8.8% as above healthy threshold with projected 30-day impact
Analyzes wealth concentration (Gini 0.72, top 1% at 38.5%) and proposes targeted sinks
Traces the compounding effect of the three recent changes on economy health
Delivers a priority-ordered action plan with specific parameter changes and timeline
